website_summaries.verdict: A decent choice if you want a simple grip that doesn't cover your entire system.
pros: Grips are angled in such a way that it will let your Nintendo Switch stand on its own
The grips move the weight of the device from your wrists to your arms
Switch will still fit in the case when in this grip
cons: While the grips are good, the rest of the case is a rather thin plastic
It will not do much to protect when dropped

customer_reviews.title: THE CASE YOUR HANDS DESERVE
customer_reviews.text: So I've owned multiple cases. The Meo case, Orts, Mumba and even the infamous Skull and Co case and I believe this is the best one, with only one flaw which is why I removed one star! It's just not as sturdy as I would like. Watch the full review I Included here on Amazon to get a better idea.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Handcramps be gone!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the case you need. Really nice and slick for a great price. Very comfortable grips and make for a nice stand as well! The grips are like some sort of rubber material so it makes it nice for sweaty palms. I would definitely recommend these grips if you have been experiencing hand cramps from gaming. Tried MK8 before these and I just COULD NOT player longer than 15 minutes without constantly flicking my wrists because they were awkward. This fixed that!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Is it possible to give 0 stars?
customer_reviews.text: Don't purchase this product. If you think playing switch in handheld mode is difficult, wait until you try and play with this grip. The side grips are not ergonomic, they don't make it easier to hit the buttons naturally. Moreover, the grip does not really fit on the switch in a way that stabilizes the system properly. The biggest problem that this creates is when you try to press down on the the upper left joy-stick, there is nothing pressing against the back of the system to support it so it won't press down without extreme effort. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Edward McCrory

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but...
customer_reviews.text: Concept is great.. but i have to ding it some points for quality. The two little clips on the top and bottom are very thin plastic and quite flimsy. Also it's not a 100% snug fit.. it doesn't feel that solid while playing as my switch giggles within the holder.
customer_reviews.author: david ngoc nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Grip it!
customer_reviews.text: It works. Feels a little cheap, but it fits the switch with no problems. And it does what it’s intended to do: add hand grips. Even though it does help the device from slipping while holding, I’m not sure pursonally if I like it on or off. I honestly use the switch more with it off. But it is VERY easy to take on and off. The price is great, so you can’t go wrong purchasing and testing it out for yourself. Probably a smart product to have on hand...
customer_reviews.author: Brian Odell

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight & simple. Didn't love the handles' contours
customer_reviews.text: Good: 1) Lightweight 2) Simple and easy to clip on/off 3) Good rubberized material on the grey handles Bad: 1) Ergos are obviously subjective to my specific hands, but I didn't like the handles' contours. I wear adult Medium-sized gloves for reference. It didn't cause immediate discomfort, but after 4-5 hours of continuous play I notice slight strain. Although I should be taking more frequent breaks anyway, but that's besides the point. Compared to the the stock Nintendo joycon controller adapter, these feel shorter, stubbier, and bulbous at the the end. I prefer the longer, consistent width of the stock grips.
customer_reviews.author: gtanaka51

customer_reviews.title: Best grip case for smaller hands
customer_reviews.text: I have both grip cases from Satisfye and Skull & Co. I went back and forth between the two cases but my hands never felt comfortable over extended play periods. I decided to try the Gripstand and even after a few hours, I didn't feel any discomfort. In fact, I feel like this is the most comfortable of the three. I think this the best grip case for smaller hands. The only thing I would change is adding a slight lip over the sides of the joycons so they can't lift towards you. I think this would keep them in the case more securely while still allowing them to slide up for removal (sort of like Satisfye grips).
customer_reviews.author: Simon S.

customer_reviews.title: Not Durable
customer_reviews.text: While the grip is not overly expensive, I still had some minimum quality standards that have not been met. After a little over six months of use, the hand grip on the right side has cracked inside and two of the three screws holding it on are separated and not repairable. I will see if some strong glue will be able to hold the grip back on, but being mostly hollow and of an unknown polymer, I’m not sure if I can find a permanent solution. It worked quite well while it lasted which is why it still gets two stars, but moderate use after six months has rendered it broken. Disappointed, and not likely to purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: C.in.ON

customer_reviews.title: Super ergonomic!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, comfortable, and one of the few Nintendo Switch grips around that actually has the grips reach out to the sides instead of just having most of the grip mass in the back behind Joy-Cons. This means that the grips go into your palms instead of your fingers, so the weight of the Switch is supported by your arms instead of your fingers and there's less hand fatigue after long play sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Paulina Chang

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done! But it’s heavy now
customer_reviews.text: Definitely works on preventing hand cramps!! I had a problem and this solved it for me. I’m sad that it actually makes the switch weigh sooo much more in my hands, and I ache more now because it’s made it heavier for me haha. The price I pay for no cramps, I suppose. I wish these came in more colors! And that there was an easier elegant way to remove it...I still dock on the dock (lol) occasionally, and I’ve accidentally removed the switch stand a couple of times while trying to take the grip off. It’s easy to put on and off, at least, can’t fault it for that.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Buy this Switch GripStand
customer_reviews.text: This is so comfortable. Disregard all the people that are saying the plastic is too flexible. It does have a little flex to it and the switch does move around in the grip the tiniest bit, but you would have to be jumping up and down or swinging your switch around while playing it to really notice the flex while playing. If you're just sitting on the couch playing a game, you aren't even going to notice. It's incredibly comfortable and more reasonably priced than most other switch grips you can find. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Zach And Christine Shumaker

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, designed for very small hands
customer_reviews.text: First off, the grips have a nice rubbery feel. That aside, almost nothing else is really good about them. They make a noble effort to minimize the amount of plastic wrapping around your console, but that also makes the grips feel incredibly loose and flimsy, creaking constantly and never quite feeling secure. Also, the ergonomics feel weird: I have relatively small hands, but the finger placements for these are SUPER small, giving me the impression they were meant for children. If you're an adult and require something solid in your hands, this might not be for you.
customer_reviews.author: AHA Says

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: Game changer... pun intended. After I started playing more using the handheld I noticed I started getting a pain in my wrist. I was skeptical that the grip would change anything but make the console heavier but Immediately after getting this grip I could feel the difference. It is more comfortable to play the handheld using this grip! It does make it a bit more clunky and I do worry about taking it off and on to dock but for $11 it’s still pretty sturdy. I also like that it can be used as a stand as well!
customer_reviews.author: Esaul

customer_reviews.title: good fitment / grip, can't return now and can't purchase carry case separate
customer_reviews.text: The grip itself is amazing, I'll update this review to 5 stars the second I can buy the carry case separate from the grip. Yes I should have researched more, but you can buy the grip by itself or you can buy the grip + carry case as a package. I'd like to save some money and have only 1 grip I need by buying just the case at this point since I cannot return anymore. My advice, buy the whole package that comes with case and grip. Do not buy this unless you don't care about the case or like having an extra grip laying around.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Saves my hands from some nasty cramps
customer_reviews.text: Long hours of Animal crossing around the house will kill your hands, especially if you work a desk job. This thing saved my hands. It's interesting how just a simple egg like shape coming off the Switch Joycons can do that, but it's really all you need for the ergonomic support your hands crave. It's also pretty cheap Cons, it's kinda squeaky. I've seen pictures where people put down some rubber or electrical tape to fix tho. Not really a big issue for me tho.
customer_reviews.author: NeroMaverick

customer_reviews.title: Great As Stand & Holding!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and very nice rubberized handles! The rubber isn’t the soft kind, but the firm kind so that you can keep a nice grip. The way the handles stick out to the side is a major advantage because it allow you to hold onto the console nicely. The grip also works very well as a stand to use the Pro Controller or the Joy Con’s separately. The way it’s housed on the console, the Joy Con’s do not have to be attached for it to work as a stand. The only downside is you cannot dock it with the grip attached.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Broke after light use
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this grip for a few months and have used it for maybe a total of 10 hours or so. The grip works fairly nicely but doesn't fit the Switch snugly, there is some looseness to it. The major issue I have is that the grip has tiny screws that hold it all together, one of these screws in the lower portion of the right handle broke loose along with the plastic screw post inside of the grip so the right handle is now no longer secure. It is now effectively useless.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for people with large hands
customer_reviews.text: As a person with rather large hands, this solved my main complaint with the Switch, as playing in portable mode was never comfortable. This grip however, makes it borderline as comfortable as a Xbox One controller with the thumb sticks and face buttons at an appropriate distance. I had tried a couple other grips, but this seems to be the only one that is truly large enough. The only downside I find is that when it is clipped on to the Switch, it does allow a little bit of wiggle, so it doesn't feel truly solid. However, not a deal breaker for something that has finally made the Switch playable in adult hands.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Fixes a significant ergonomic issue
customer_reviews.text: This handle will save your thumbs from repetitive motion damage. My son was very excited when he attached it to his Switch. He immediately started talking about how his thumbs didn't hurt. Which then made me realize, he wasn't telling me that his thumbs hurt because he knew I wouldn't let him play it very frequently. Let me assure you that your kids' thumbs are probably hurting too. This might save them from permanent damage in their hands.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this grip works great and is incredibly comfortable even in my large hands that tend to cramp up easily. I honestly can't say anything bad about this product. So why only 2 stars? Because according to the description I was supposed to also receive a free pair of thumb grips but I didn't get my thumb grips. I contacted the seller but the douche decided to have the " I got your money now suck it " attitude. So I'll be sure to avoid that seller in the future. Great product just an incompetent seller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift we have had it for about 4 months nows and its perfect deff feels cheap and flimsy so we are just extra careful for to sit on it for. Throw it around but once on it feels find and. Makes playing. Much for enjoyable we play fortnite with it and it's perfect your hands don't. Cramp and u have a better hold on it in general you can't keep. It on when the switch is docked so u have to put it on and take it off every some but it's very easy to put on and take off Def recommend
customer_reviews.author: alex96

customer_reviews.title: A 5 Star Must-Own Product!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! 100% recommend for the price!! I tried the Satisfye AND Skull and Co. case/grips and didn’t come near as satisfied as I did with this one! As I read reviews, I noticed they must have changed up the design. A lot of people were complaining about creaking noises but it looks like Nintendo/RDS addresses this by adding a rubber “notch” under both Joycon. Absolutely no creaking from this product! Also it looks like they added 3 slots for 3 game cards or SD card holders.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Makes handheld gameplay much more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This did exactly what I had hoped it would. The grips make it so much more comfortable when playing my Switch in handheld mode. My only complaint is that the fit is not exactly perfect. It seems that there is a little bit of space from the back of the console to one side or the other and can move a bit when pushing buttons on that side. It seems like the frame is flexed a bit forward near the middle so the console rocks to each side. This hasn't caused me any problems while playing and is not scratching my console so I am still overall pleased for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Potocki

customer_reviews.title: Better than Satisfye
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have Joy-Con drift and want a great snap on option this is it. Firmly holds the Switch, props it up like a stand on a surface if you're wanting to watch a video or play it in a party setting. Only need to be kinda careful taking it out but absolutely love and recommend this. Have two fronteo different systems. It will not dock with the grip on though.
customer_reviews.author: Deiradinn

customer_reviews.title: Best accessory
customer_reviews.text: This is the BEST holder for the switch I was having a problem with my son bending the controls while playing but this is perfect to hold for me a bit bulky for my 6 year old but he will just have to get used to it. It really holds everything steady and helps it from the controllers coming out. I don't love the way Nintendo made the controllers my son already broke one off cause it's so flimsy but this helps 100% . It also has 3 spaces for games.
customer_reviews.author: Katerina Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying, Rattling issues seem to be fixed now
customer_reviews.text: Definitely recommend this grip, DONT expect it it to save your device from a fall but it really is great for long sessions. I believe that the the manufacturers of this product are listening to the reviews because my grip was a bit updated than the pictures previously posted. They fixed the issue with the back of the grip rattling against the joycons by adding a piece of rubber. Worth the buy. You may feel a bit odd using it at first but once you get it you won’t go back.
customer_reviews.author: junior

customer_reviews.title: So much better!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase this based on other reviews describing how the grip doesn’t fit well. However, after receiving the product, it appears that they’ve revised the design (see packaging and photos). There are now two rubber pads behind the joy cons and I experience none of the creaking or fitment issues others have with their grip. This product makes longer gaming sessions on handheld mode so much better!
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: For MY hands they're not PERFECT, they do do the job though so I can't really complain, after months I found theres a groove where I think your fingers are suppose to go, No possible way of me holding it as comfortably as I can and getting my fingers in there. BUT It's also not horrible/bad/not working as designed enough for me to go buy a different grip so.
customer_reviews.author: Me and Just ME

customer_reviews.title: Poor Fit
customer_reviews.text: The Switch feels wobbly inside the holder. I wanted to use this for playing while in bed but I can't lay back and play because the Switch is too loose when held vertically or upside down. Also, you have to turn off the rumble feature while using this because the switch vibrating against the plastic makes a worrying and obnoxious noise. Was able to fix these issues by adding some felt padding, but it's still a little awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Harry James Puckett

customer_reviews.title: A Good Option if The Plastic Holds Up
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Comfortable in hand The grips feel pretty nice You can use it in table top mode Cons: I don't know that I can really considered this a con since the grip has held up but I feel like the plastic housing is a bit thin and will break if you're not careful removing the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Keyser RevealTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great to prevent hand fatigue
customer_reviews.text: This product is nice for prolonged play and feels great in your hands. My biggest complaint is it so cheap and flimsy it could break any second. Just picking it up causes the plastic the bend slightly and creek. For the price I guess it's somewhat tolerable but come on its 2019 we can make phones you can run over with cars without marking it. Use at minimum a mediocre material for your product that doesn't feel like recycled plastic from the garbage island floating in the ocean.
customer_reviews.author: Aly Sorosiak

customer_reviews.title: Great product but recieved a previously owned opened box
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these for myself, it came perfectly and it really is great to hold the switch and to stabilize the joycons. However, i ordered one for my son and it obviously was preowned as the box was literally ripped opened from the bottom (shipping box was not damaged). So that's why I gave them 4 stars, had this not been for a present I may have not cared as much. :(
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grip if you have sm/med hands
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely better than no grip. This grip would be perfect for a smaller kid or a woman. I have big man hands and the grip is a bit small still. If you got smaller hands buy this! It will be amazing. If you have larger hands, I would still buy it because it makes the switch so much better in hand held mode. Great product, just a bit small for larger hands.
customer_reviews.author: Shockey

customer_reviews.title: Great grip, feels great in hands.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little grip for the price. I have larger hands and my hands going numb after playing for 30 min undocked was an issue after getting this that all went away. Only knock is the switch rocks a little in the grip as if it’s not completely flush against the sides, but that hasn’t really been an issue in use. The fact it stands on its own is great too, keeps you from using the kick stand and wearing it out.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Castro

customer_reviews.title: The grips are a little small and my hands still cramp.
customer_reviews.text: It's certainly convenient that it also doubles as a stand and the grips are better than no grip. BUT because the grips don't extend much below the the switch, it's still fairly awkward to hold because my pinkies don't have as much grip, and my hands still end up cramping. I also have really small hands (I'm 5'0).
customer_reviews.author: minac

customer_reviews.title: comfortable. works great!
customer_reviews.text: Simple and excellent. I think it fits just perfect. The grip size is what I was looking for, just a nice add on to fit into my palm, without changing my thumb placement. I have a much easier time using the shoulder buttons now. The grips stays on just fine, but can still be popped off easily when you want to remove it. If it helps, have the hand size of an adult woman, about 3 to 3.5 inches across horizontally. The grip is very comfortable. My husband thinks the grip is pretty good too, but prefers the larger daemon x machina joycons (both the different grip and button placement on those controllers.)
customer_reviews.author: Lehst

customer_reviews.title: Good solution for large hands
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grip. It makes it more comfortable to play my switch in handheld mode. I purchased it by itself because I already had a case from RDS for my switch. I would recommend purchasing it with the carrying case designed for it though. My original RDS case cannot hold the grip while attached to the switch so I can't take it with me. It is a great product otherwise and improves the usability of the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great Grip
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grip; although not dockable, I'd buy it if i had a second switch. It's really comfortable and its light it also has 3 game slot molded into the grip, It can be used as a stand but not while charging unless you can find a 90 degree usb-c switch compatible charging cable.
customer_reviews.author: JTF

customer_reviews.title: An Essential Switch Accessory
customer_reviews.text: If you only buy one accessory for your switch, it should be this. It instantly made handheld mode about 10 times more comfortable, and it works infinitely better as a kickstand than the built-in one that Nintendo gave us. Plus it's so easy to snap on and off, unlike just about every other similar product I've seen. 100% worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Trask

customer_reviews.title: No more hand cramps
customer_reviews.text: This easily slides on and off the Switch. I don't have to remove the joycons or anything and I still have access to all slots. There is a very minor wiggle, but I only notice it if I am actively trying to move the gripstand. It is comfortable enough to play with for hours.
customer_reviews.author: BrianT

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable grip
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable grip. Really makes me want to play games in handheld mode because of the comfort. Easy installation. Makes you feel similar playing on a pro controller. Problems I have is that it does not fit inside a dock like other grips in sites other than Amazon. And taking it off too often might break it someday. Also grips might use padding of some kind to add to the comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Garavito

customer_reviews.title: Great feel, but creaky without some padding
customer_reviews.text: This is a great feel if you play handheld. As others have said, needs some padding in between the product and the switch or it's creaky and weird. I used some of the foam that came in the packaging and voila, no squeaks and creaks. Slightly inconvenient having to do that though I suppose. But I never play handheld with out it now.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Gormely

customer_reviews.title: Product OK, but original packing was in bad shape
customer_reviews.text: The product seems adequate, but I was disappointed that the package was damaged. The shipping box looked just fine, so this product was obviously taken from stock and shipped with defective original packaging. This was a Christmas gift, so it would have made a better impression without the damage.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Ogle

customer_reviews.title: Makes everything better
customer_reviews.text: I love my switch except for the controls. This makes it about 1,000 times easier to play handheld. My hands still hurt after playing for too long, but not nearly as much. The grips feel nice and put the buttons in a more natural position. It does feel a little loose on the system, but it needs to be to get it on and off easily. It will not fit in the charger with it on.
customer_reviews.author: sarahr84

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: This product claims to come with free thumbstick grips. THAT. IS. A. LIE. When I originally ordered this and the grips were not included I though it was just a simple mistake. But no. After talking with Amazon and having replacements sent out and none of them contained the thumbstick grips either. This product is falsely advertising free inclusions that you will not get. If you are ordering this grip listing over another because it has the "FREE" in the title, just ignore it. You are only setting yourself up to be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Blythe

customer_reviews.title: Super comfy
customer_reviews.text: I love it! My hands started tickling when I played the Switch in handheld mode but with this I feel absolutely comfortable! I had the 2017 model of this grip and it was lighter but on the other hand you can store up to three games. I really recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina

customer_reviews.title: Missing "joysticks"....
customer_reviews.text: The grip is great and the cloth is cool too but man i was a little let down at the fact that the order was missing the "free joysticks" it claimed to come with. I ordered this for my wife overseas and paying more for shipping than the actual item, so of course i had told her what was coming and she was just as excited as i was since i have the same grip and i absolutely love mine. All in all she has her grip now so i suppose that's all that matters, I just feel lied to. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Kaal

customer_reviews.title: It’s not perfect, but I’m happy with it for the price
customer_reviews.text: The grip is just a little bit too big for my comfort. I’m used to the PS4 and Xbox controller, and you have to reach a bit farther to hit the buttons than you would on those. That said it’s better than nothing and for $12 not bad at all.
customer_reviews.author: s olson

customer_reviews.title: My Grandson LOVES this!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our Grandson for Christmas. He was thrilled! He loved how much more comfortable his Nintendo Switch was to play with the new hand grips. He also loved the new colored controllers. Very happy we bought this for him.
customer_reviews.author: MDownes

customer_reviews.title: Best grip I used for the Switch
customer_reviews.text: After using many different grips and cases. This is the best grip out there, hands down. Only 2 notes : 1- The Switch wiggles little unless you put some duct tape on the inside to help secure it which is easy. 2- Might be little bit small for people with large hands compared to Satisfy's grip. This product is worth it and it's made out of high quality materials.
customer_reviews.author: Suliman

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price but...
customer_reviews.text: echoing what others have said, the case does not corretly fit the joycons. when you press down on the right side, it squeaks because there is a gap between the joycon and the casing. This is fixed by putting a two-sided sticky pad (sorta like the ones that come with nail-free picture hanging kits) behind the joycon and on the case. I would rate this 4 stars but honestly this is a pretty significant manufacturing error. This could in time damage someone's rail on the switch, or simply break the joycon off.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect, for large hands
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband who has large hands and he loves it. Does complain that his switch rattles a bit in it though. I would recommend this for someone with large hands, I tried it myself and it was uncomfortable for me to hold with small hands. I took off the star because of the rattle which could be fixed with some 3m squares where you pop your switch in.
customer_reviews.author: PurlJam

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and crappy.
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived two of the screws on the right grip were broken off so it made a loud clamping sound when you grabbed it, not to mention the fact it didn't grip the console tightly, and there's no way to change that. Even after i duct taped the grip so it didn't flop around it still felt like garbage. It definitely isn't something I want holding this expensive switch with. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Crenshaw

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!... with a small catch
customer_reviews.text: Before I bought this, i had the switch for almost a year and my biggest issue was that my pinky would always fall asleep cause of the pressure and the way I held the switch. I decided to buy a grip and this being the most affordable it seemed like a steal! It is the right size and makes the switch feel more like a large scale controller than an large slab. The only issue is that it isn't entirely fitted properly so it does have some wobble and give but a couple of months of use later and I can't use my switch without it!
customer_reviews.author: Brando

customer_reviews.title: Bad for large hands, creaky
customer_reviews.text: This product has a big problem that ruins the whole thing. There is a dip where your fingers are supposed to go I assume if you have very small hands. This is super uncomfortable if you have large hands. If the handles were like an Xbox 360 controller, it would be SO much more comfortable. Also, the grip isn't spaced properly, so you have to add some kind of material near the joycons, otherwise it will creak. These two problems could easily be fixed in a hardware revision, so please do that. I also found it kind of deceptive that the picture for the product includes third party thumbstick grips even though they are not included.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Albert

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for big hands
customer_reviews.text: Thia grip is great if you have long fingers/big hands. It is longer than the one they sell with a case, but idk if it fits in that case. My hands cramp using the older PS controllers (which is literally the only reason I play on xbox.) Its not MASSIVELY bigger, but noticeably bigger. I would tie it with the case version only because the case version comes with thumb grips.
customer_reviews.author: Benji

customer_reviews.title: 100/10 I am in love
customer_reviews.text: Before I purchased this I had the jetech case, it was alright but my hands still felt cramped after gaming for a few hours so I never enjoyed handheld. So I watched some YouTube reviews and ran into this grip/case. I’m glad I ordered it because it is sooo amazing feels so comfortable and it’s definitely a switch must have!
customer_reviews.author: jasmine allen

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, if inconvenient
customer_reviews.text: Let me just say that it does what it says it will do. It does give better grip for handheld mode and is great for long bus or plane rides. It's pretty flimsy when not being in use so be careful storing it. It also doesn't fit well on the Switch itself, it slides side to side a bit and application is difficult. Mine hasn't broken yet, but I feel like it might only last for about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Carnes

customer_reviews.title: It’s like a Hand grip for the Nintendo Switch
customer_reviews.text: It didn’t come with the screen protector as advised. But I think I got sent an official one by Nintendo by mistake. It came with a cloth wipe instead. Either way. I enjoy it. It def helps if you have bigger hands. Made FPS games easier to deal with handheld. This is Fat Nerd approved
customer_reviews.author: Papo

customer_reviews.title: Try it! You'll love it
customer_reviews.text: I'll never play my Switch without this grip again. It's super easy to put and take off. The plastic that grabs the console looks and feels flimsy but overtime I've realized that it is really flexible and better quality than I thought. I totally recommend this grip.
customer_reviews.author: JH.

customer_reviews.title: Nintendo seal of approval?  How?
customer_reviews.text: Hand grips feel great and supply comfort, but that's the only thing that this grip offers. The grip can be best described as flimsy; it not only bends in and out while on the Nintendo, but is so structurally weak that it can actually twist in your hands causing a scratching sound from the plastic on Switch action. Save yourself a loss with this one . There are better grips out there. No protection, or satisfaction will be found here.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Extremely noticeable comfort over long play gaming.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really nice. Makes a huge difference in comfort. Easier for my son to use then the satisfye grip. Both are nice though. This is better for smaller hands though. I definitely should've purchased the case bundle though. It has some room for improvement but still a great product as it is.
customer_reviews.author: Angel De Jesus Castaneda

customer_reviews.title: grip is oddly positioned
customer_reviews.text: I ended up re-gifting my grip to my young nieces. The positioning of the grip made the distance to the buttons kind of awkward and I didn't use it more than a few times because of that. They'll definitely use it for the stand function (which looked handy).
customer_reviews.author: K. Casey

customer_reviews.title: Great product with no negativity but one.
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can actually play my switch in handheld mode without my hands hurting. but my one thing that I did not like is the fit going horizontally is a little loose so I got some medical gauze and cut it in half and taped it in and now the switch doesn't slide or anything anymore. But other than that problem there's nothing else bad and I really love it and now I've been playing my switch a whole lot now.
customer_reviews.author: Rosendo Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This does an amazing job at keeping my hands comfortable. It is not a 100% snug fit so it can shift somewhat, but that hasn't bothered me/affected gameplay.
customer_reviews.author: lurns

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! No more hand cramps and FPS games are a little easier to manage. Fits my switch perfectly. Hopefully it doesn't leave any scratches, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B

customer_reviews.title: Game Changer
customer_reviews.text: These bad boys fundamentally change how playing the switch feels. 100% more comfortable, and they double as a nice kind of kick stand type thing so you don't have to lay it down. Must have accessory for the Switch.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew McClaugherty

customer_reviews.title: Good grip case, thumbstick grips are a lie
customer_reviews.text: I like the grips for sure, plenty of room and a nice size, and it does stand up for playing. But don't expect the thumbstick covers. They do not come with the case. At least the cleaning cloth does.
customer_reviews.author: Darling of the job

customer_reviews.title: Satisfy is better.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't care for this. They are short and wide. It feels like I was holding ping pong balls while playing the switch. The satisfy grip is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Ray

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty good
customer_reviews.text: are there better ones out there? Yes but this one is decent for the money I have had no problems with it, it’s snaps on my switch really easy. All in all good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Hollister Kirk

customer_reviews.title: much more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself as someone with adult-sized hands and it's made handheld mode distinctly more comfortable and less stress on my elbow. it's reasonably easy to get on and off. there is a very slight wiggle but I stopped noticing it quickly.
customer_reviews.author: abadidea

customer_reviews.title: Daughter seems happy
customer_reviews.text: I can't really give a review, but it is an item my daughter asked for and she hasn't complained, so I'm assuming it's a great item.
customer_reviews.author: Carol K. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Okay for price.
customer_reviews.text: They work but are uncomfortable after a while, I feel like they are too wide on the hand grips and it makes it difficult to play and the joy cons are already uncomfortable with the small buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Item’s images are incorrect
customer_reviews.text: This is not the one I ordered. I was trying to buy the original version. This seems to be the newer version. This one has fatter and shorter grips. It’s not as comfortable. Too busy dealing with evacuation due to Oregon wildfires to try to get the correct one though.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin M

customer_reviews.title: Big hands? No problem
customer_reviews.text: I have big hands and found holding the naked switch uncomfortable. My fingers would tingle and go numb and wrists would be strained after extended gameplay. Slip your switch into something more comfortable. Trust me, you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Defever3

customer_reviews.title: Eliminated hand pain
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't even play my switch due to excruciating pain/cramps after playing. It would affect my hands for days afterwards- I couldn't even type on a keyboard if I had played the switch. Ordered this to hopefully fix that issue and it worked like a charm. Now I can play my switch as long as I like and my hand pain/cramps are completely gone.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Does not include free accessories as claimed
customer_reviews.text: The grip seems to be fine, but it absolutely does NOT come with free accessories like analog stick covers. Just the grip, so it’s a little misleading in the description, especially considering it’s an “Amazon Choice” product.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This grip case makes handheld play far more comfortable. This is much easier to attach and remove than other style grip cases available for the same price. The rubber grip is great, the fit is great, and the overall comfort is great.
customer_reviews.author: Duh Slacks

customer_reviews.title: Made playing my Switch better
customer_reviews.text: This made it easier to play my Switch in hand held mode. Before my fingers would cramp after a little while. This helps with that. I heard there is one a little bit bigger than this one but it cost a lot more too. Not the best but it is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: richard scheck

customer_reviews.title: Fit needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: The product itself does what it's supposed to; however, you will notice movement in the grips when it's attached to your switch. The easiest way to fix this is electrical tape. I took several pieces and lined the curve of the grip in the interior. This filled the gap and stopped the grip from moving so much. For the price - it's not a bad product. Just be aware that it's not a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Best grip
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite grip for the switch I own 2 of them and the 2nd one came with a hard case that the grip fits in.. I got the case kit at target.
customer_reviews.author: Killamilla0513

customer_reviews.title: Great grips that helps with larger hands from going numb
customer_reviews.text: This definitely helps from my hands going numb after playing for more than 15 minutes. One of my only main cons is that it's not snug enough around the console, so it creaks a little but not much. Luckily it comes off the console without problem, which was a main con with another similar case.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Darnell

customer_reviews.title: Must have for the Switch!
customer_reviews.text: This makes the Switch so much more comfortable to play. I primarily play with it as a handheld and this is a game changer!
customer_reviews.author: jrbush91

customer_reviews.title: Much more comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I snipped out the bottom center section so I can just place it in my (aftermarket) dock.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Life saver for your hands
customer_reviews.text: Makes long gaming sessions much more manageable. Definitely recommend. My only issue is it doesn’t have built in game cartridge storage.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: too small for 30 yr old hands, no thumb pads included
customer_reviews.text: When gripped comfortably in my hand, my default thumb position is over the + and - buttons. I'd rather they be over the joypad and a,b,y,x buttons. Also, there were no thumbpads included.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Parry

customer_reviews.title: So awesome
customer_reviews.text: My hands feel so much better after hours of gaming with this. Glad I purchased this grip for my switch.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, well built, worth a check out.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grip for the switch. I really love it. I play switch exclusively handheld, so I actually used double sided tape to make it somewhat permanent... I have a baby and she grabs things, lol. Worth your time if you play handheld. The grip holds tight, its makes the controllers feel very comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M.

customer_reviews.title: repaced the one that came with my switch
customer_reviews.text: loved this product. my 4yr old broke the original one and i was able to order this one and it thr exact same one i had.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Very ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: Very ergonomic but it would be nice if it collapsed or folded up. I did not receive the thumbsticks like listed though. Most cases for the switch won’t fit this inside.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Feels really good for the most part but came with one of the handles not fully in tact, secured it myself because I didn’t find it to be worth returning since it’s so cheap already. Good but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac

customer_reviews.title: Good quality grip
customer_reviews.text: Grip works really well for holding the Switch while out and about. Easy to use and goes on easily to console. Great for younger kids to be able to hold onto.
customer_reviews.author: David R Bartel

customer_reviews.title: easy to use - comfortable
customer_reviews.text: not much else to say about it. It's great and highly recommended. I wish it was collapsable so it can be stored in my case (this is the only reason I gave it 4 stars).
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for adult hands
customer_reviews.text: The Nintendo switch is so uncomfortable to hold, my kid doesn't seem to mind, but my hands are bigger than hers and I need more support. This thing is a life saver, it's perfect, fits perfect in my hands, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this grip so much!
customer_reviews.text: My Wife got me this for Christmas because I had heard that having a grip like this made handheld mode more comfortable. I cannot overstate how much more I enjoy handheld mode. I feel like I can focus less on gripping the system and more on games and moving my hands quickly. Get one of these! They are so great!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: It's not a pack
customer_reviews.text: The Nintendo Switch GripStand worked well with my switch, just disappointed because it says it's a pack and I was hoping to also have a carrying case to come with it. The tittle is misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Romyboy

customer_reviews.title: “I love it !” I actually wanna play in portable mode
customer_reviews.text: -I got this grip because I didn’t like the “satisfy grip” it was kinda loose and didn’t like the grip. This grip is so comfortable & feels so right in portable mode just a little loose, but not as bad as Satisfy that’s for sure 👍
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good to play smash with. Good qualify. Only thing when the case is on the switch, the switch itself has a little play play/wiggle room when playing. May be good or not good thing. But it a good case.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Convenient for handheld; cant dock it though...
customer_reviews.text: I love how this feels while I'm playing a game playing down on my bed, but the only one thing I complain about (not just about this product but for all other grip holders) is that you can't dock your switch with it on.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Grips!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! If you like using your switch in the “mobile” way, you will love these grips!
customer_reviews.author: Tiana

product_meta.title: Officially Licensed Nintendo Switch GoPlay GripStand - Comfortable & Ergonomic - Includes Cleaning Cloth
product_meta.description: Size:GripStand| Color:Black/grayThe Nintendo Switch grip Stand provides comfortable grip and system control to enhance game play. When you're playing with the Joy-Con controllers while detached, the grip Stand serves as a convenient viewing Stand. The grip Stand is designed for easy Joy-Con attachment and detachment. Kit also comes with a Switch cleaning cloth to keep your Switch screen clean.
feature_bullets: RDS Industries is the #1 Nintendo Licensed accessories manufacturer nationwide. Products are made with superior quality materials.
GoPlay Grip Stand provides comfortable grip and system control to enhance game play
GoPlay Grip Stand serves as viewing stand when playing with detached Joy-Con Controllers
GoPlay Grip Stand designed for easy Joy-Con attachment and detachment
Switch Cleaning Cloth soft material keeps screen clean

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars979 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
